issue.title: Improve state management in all character creation screens
issue.body: Simplify state management, using character class screen as a reference. Should only require the key in state, and convert arrays to maps to pull once per screen render.

issue.title: Allow custom themes
issue.body:
Will need to redo theming consistently across screens, i.e.

1. Remove custom theming as is and enforce default with `withTheme`.
2. Identify and document all themable elements.
3. Add Consumer pattern to all themable elements.

issue.title: Achieve full test coverage
issue.body: This includes general app usage and building characters.

issue.title: Enable soft deletes/archiving for campaigns/characters
issue.body:
Allow for archiving campaigns/characters, hiding them from display, but keeping them in the collection.

Should update the button to show "archive" and do a full delete from the archive page.

issue.title: Split character creation into 2 modes
issue.body:
### Quick Mode

Fill out basic information very quickly. The fastest way to attach characters to a campaign. You can edit your character later to add in additional information.

### Guided Mode

Similar to how 0.1.0-alpha's character creation process went by default. It will walk the player through creating their character and will explain each part of the process. It is great for new players.

issue.title: Session Management
issue.body:
A campaign can last for months, with various sessions that can take hours. It would be nice to log a session in the background while providing an interface where the user can commit actions including, but not limited to:

- Rolling a dice and get a result.
- Updating HP for combat.
- Declaring items acquired and lost.
- Declaring currency earned and spent.

It would be great to log these actions and be able to save them and possibly export them if desired (e.g. as a .pdf). Actions would be in a bulleted list in the following format as an example:

```
Session 12: <Custom label to address this session>

<Timestamp> <Tiny heart icon as bullet> Took damage: 12 HP lost, <custom note regarding negative random event>
<Timestamp> <Tiny heart icon as bullet> Healed: 12 HP lost, <custom note regarding healing>
<Timestamp> <Tiny sword icon as bullet> Combat engaged: dealt 8 damage, <custom note regarding ambush and skill use>
```

At the end, a report on changes can be created as follows:

```
Session 12: Results

<Tiny clock icon as bullet> Time Spent: 3:45:08
<Tiny gold icon as bullet> Net Profit: +100 <currency>
<List of items acquired>
<List of items lost>
<Achievements/Feats earned>
<Tiny heart icon as bullet> Health: 15 -> 12
<Tiny level icon as bullet> Level: 5 -> 8
```

issue.title: Campaign Notes
issue.body: Characters can have various long texts associated with them. For example, characters can have a vast backstory and descriptions of their personalities and flaws. Sometimes, things will happen in campaigns that may require note-taking beyond keeping track of HP, etc. A section to keep notes in text forms as well as attaching documents (e.g. .doc, .docx, .pdf) would be a nice addition.

issue.title: Enable soft deletes/archiving for campaigns/characters
issue.body:
Allow for archiving campaigns/characters, hiding them from display, but keeping them in the collection.

Should update the button to show "archive" and do a full delete from the archive page.

issue.title: Import and export campaigns/characters
issue.body: An option to import and export campaigns/characters for others to use or to view in various formats (text report, .pdf, write to character sheet, etc.)

issue.title: Fix list display issue in character background selection screen
issue.body: Bulleted list item is offset by a bit on next line due to text overflow (improper newline placement?).

issue.title: Update component lifecycle methods
issue.body: Some lifecycle methods are no longer deemed safe. This requires uplifting some of the dependencies that used to rely on them, i.e. seeing if they have workarounds in place before it becomes a hard stop in React 17+ or moving to other solutions.

issue.title: Move to new key-value storage solution
issue.body: Simple store uses unlinked new location and expo does not support it. Consider moving to expo's secure key-value storage solution or selecting another one.
